page.title: 15THE GRANTHAM CANAL
page.content: Yesterday we went with Mr. Meadows, our teacher, to visit the Grantham Canal. We found it on the map at grid reference 3666. The canal is very old and has got bricks falling from the side. The canal is at least 20 feet deep in places. It has trees growing in it now. Near to where we visited there was a bridge over the canal. The bridge had a number 11 on it. We had to go through a gate. It was very stiff. We had to be careful with our feet; you could tell that cows had been there! We could see three farms. On our walk we passed Manns bridge and Hollygate Farm. We had to walk round the back of the pit tip. The tip is very big and it is interesting to think that all the stuff came from hundreds of feet underground.
